website_summaries.verdict: The Shadow 6000 from Saucony is a robust running shoe that offers a lot of service to runners who need stability, comfort and durable protection. It is a daily shoe that athletes can use for mid-tempo trainings. Given all the positive praised from users, the Shadow 6000 is indeed an above-average running partner.
pros: A suede upper with leather overlays improved the overall durability of the material while giving off a distinctly cool look, according to a large number of runners
Most reviewers appreciated the padded collar and tongue, which enhanced the comfort of the skin and generally offered a snug fit
The Ethylene vinyl acetate mid-sole is a reliable mid-sole material that gives responsive underfoot cushioning and springiness with each step
The Triangular Lugs on the outsole unit lets the Shadow 6000 take hold of dry and wet surfaces
This running shoe has an affordable price
cons: There were runners who felt that the Shadow 600 needed a waterproofing mechanic to fully provide a seamless experience during all types of weather conditions
Some reviewers noted that it looked too bulky and that it felt too stiff
Others felt that it was a bit tight in the forefoot area

customer_reviews.title: Hard, no cushion
customer_reviews.text: Hard sole. Definitely not the original, but then we know that. It’s just that I was expecting a little better cushioning effect. There is almost no give in these. Still, all is not bad. They look like the original so that’s nice. The other thing not so good is the stiffness of the sides. Not sure how to describe that, but it’s like you’re slipping your foot into a cardboard box instead of a nice comfy shoe. Once the shoe is on it is okay, but I have definitely worn more comfortable sneakers. Had I tried this on in a store I would not have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Dameron

customer_reviews.title: Knock off

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought over 20 pairs of the Shadow 6000 since it was introduced about 15 years ago. I run at a decent pace and put about 400 miles on each pair. They have never caused any injury or soreness. And I have tried a number of $100 plus shoes and always go back to the Shadows. I hope they keep making them!

customer_reviews.title: it's now made in vietnam -- not the same shoe as when produced in china
customer_reviews.text: i've been running in the shadow 6000 since it came out-- when i ordered my last pair i noticed the men's color was purple and suede was being used. it's now made in vietnam vs china -- order 1/2 size bigger -- but the shoe feels stiffer -- it's just not the same feel. i alternated between the china and vietnam made shoes --- the china made ones are much more comfortable.

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Shadow 6000 Sneaker
product_meta.description: In celebration of our history, Saucony Originals is bringing back some of its most iconic silhouettes in their original colors. These shadow 6000 shoes are updated with premium suede paneling their original early-90's colorways.
feature_bullets: TPU heel piece for extra support
Soft fabric lining and additional tongue and collar cushion
